docs.lead_paragraph: Broader stock markets trembled in the first half of the day, and gave up moderate gains as investors watched to see how far the flu cases would spread.

docs.lead_paragraph: Children with attention deficit problems make bigger academic gains if they are taking stimulant medications compared to similar kids who aren’t receiving drug therapy, a new study shows.

headline.main: A.D.H.D. Drugs Linked to Higher Test Scores

docs.abstract: Children taking medications for attention deficit problems made bigger academic gains than similar kids who were not receiving drug therapy.
docs.snippet: Children taking medications for attention deficit problems made bigger academic gains than similar kids who were not receiving drug therapy.

docs.lead_paragraph: The death rate for cancer has barely changed since 1950, despite Richard M. Nixon’s pledge to cure cancer in five years. Now, President Obama is making a similar vow.

headline.seo: Pledged to Find Cancer Cure, but Advances Prove Elusive
headline.main: Advances Elusive in the Drive to Cure Cancer
headline.print_headline: In Long Drive to Cure Cancer, Advances Have Been Elusive

docs.snippet: The death rate for cancer has barely changed since 1950, despite Richard M. Nixon’s pledge to cure cancer in five years. Now, President Obama is making a similar vow.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mike Sager is a former Washington Post staff writer and Rolling Stone contributing editor. He is also the bestselling author of three collections and a novel, and has been a writer at large at Esquire for nearly a dozen years. His recent profile of Todd Marinovich in Esquire is a must read for college football fans. It's a compelling portrait of a superior athlete whose training methods at the hands of his father made him a curiosity and whose talent made him a star. Then he lost it all to drug addiction, a battle he is still fighting. Mike Sager was nice enough to answer some questions over e-mail and give us some further insight into the world of Todd Marinovich.

headline.main: Quad Q&A: Esquire's Mike Sager on Todd Marinovich

docs.abstract: Mike Sager answers questions about his recent profile of the former U.S.C. quarterback Todd Marinovich in Esquire.
docs.snippet: Mike Sager answers questions about his recent profile of the former U.S.C. quarterback Todd Marinovich in Esquire.

docs.lead_paragraph: The F.D.A. has lowered the age limit to 17, from 18, for sale of the emergency contraceptive pill Plan B.

docs.lead_paragraph: FREDDIE OFFICIAL FOUND DEAD David B. Kellermann, the acting chief financial officer at Freddie Mac, died, apparently in a suicide. Colleagues and friends said Mr. Kellermann, 41, had been working nonstop and had been under enormous stress. RECESSION IN JAPAN Japan is seeking to send home Latin Americans who are being laid off in the recession. Wellington Shibuya, left, a foreign worker who lost his job, said, ''They put up with us as long as they needed the labor.'' [B1.]
